newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - April 1.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - April 1.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
PEOPLE'S DAILY
- Communist Party, State Council issue 13-point joint decision ordering all localities and departments to reduce burdens on farmers by cancelling all kinds of illegal levies.
- China releases white paper on progress in human rights cause in 1996.
XINHUA DAILY TELEGRAPH
- Premier Li Peng tells visiting Australian Prime Minister John Howard that China and Australia should join hands in pushing forward development of bilateral relations
- Premier Li Peng urges young scientists to open minds and be adventurous in research to make greater contributions to development of science and technology and modernisation.
PEOPLE'S DAILY OVERSEAS EDITION
- China to open trading rights on imports of rubber, steel, wood, cashmere, acrylic fibre, plywood in three years
- China to control trade in wheat, crude oil, oil products, fertiliser, cotton, tobacco
CHINA SECURITIES
- Bank of China launches forward yuan-dollar trading to offset risks in forex trading
- Sichuan province to give special policies to support selected firms such as Sichuan Changhong
FINANCIAL NEWS
- Bank of China boosts management of loans in 1996
- Bank of Communications loans 600 million yuan to second line of Shanghai underground
INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS DAILY
- China sets 33 percent income tax for foreign banks handling renminbi yuan business
- State Council approves Oriental Group to become major trading conglomerate after Sinochem
CHINA BUSINESS TIMES
- Vice Premier Zhou Jiahua says lack of controls leads to rampant use of farmland
- China's liquor production hits 6.5 million tonnes in 1996, causes grain shortages in Gansu province
- Inner Mongolia region lacks funds to build storage facilities for grain
- Guangxi border trade with Vietnam hit 3.136 billion yuan in 1996, up 17.9 percent
BEIJING ECONOMIC DAILY
- Yanshan Petrochemical to stop produce leaded petrol from April 1
CHINA DAILY
- China pledges to further improve living, studying and labour reform environment of prisoners by 2000, says official of Ministry of Justice
- Two Chinese vessels will soon embark for northeastern Pacific Ocean to prospect for natural resources.
- Safety authorities launch crusade against road accident deaths
